title.narrative: Integrating Overlooked Refugee Populations into SGBV Prevention and Response Mechanisms in Chad, Kenya, South Africa, and Uganda

description.narrative: At-risk refugee populations(men and boys, sexual minorities, disabled and older persons)

Objective 1.1: To identify SGBV protection gaps experienced by at-risk refugee populations (men and boys, sexual minorities, disabled and older persons) in Chad, Kenya, South Africa and Uganda and assess the degree to which their needs are currently integrated into SGBV programming carried out by UNHCR offices, Implementing Partners (IPs), and other stakeholders in target countries. Objective 1.2: Develop a Training Curriculum for UNHCR offices, IPs, and other stakeholders in Cad, Kenya, South Africa and Uganda to effectively reach and serve at-risk refugee populations (men and boys, sexual minorities, disabled and older persons) in SGBV strategies and programming. Objective 1.3: To assess the effectiveness of new UNHCR SGBV training materials used by UNHCR SGBV trainers in Chad, Kenya, South Africa and Uganda. Objective 2.1: To increase the capacity of SGBV staff trainers from UNHCR offices, IPS, and other stakeholders in Chad, Kenya, South Africa and Uganda to train colleagues to reach and serve at-risk refugee populations(men and boys, sexual minorities, disabled and older persons) in SGBV programming. Objective 2.2: To provide a framework for robust referral networks between refugees and organizational stakeholders to increase protection for and empower at-risk refugee populations in SGBV prevention and response programming. Objective 3.1: To increase the capacity of SGBV staff trainers from UNHCR offices, IPs, and other stakeholders in Chad, Kenya, South Africa and Uganda to train colleagues to reach and serve at-risk refugee populations (men and boys, sexual minorities, disabled and older persons) in SGBV programming. Objective 3.3: To asses the impact of SGBV training and working groups on integration of at-risk refugee populations (men and boys, sexual minorities, diabled and older persons) into SGBV strategies and programming carried out by UNHCR offices, IPs, and ohter stakeholders in Chad, Kenya, South Africa and Uganda.

The project seeks to better integrate the needs of at-risk refugee populations (men and boys, sexual minorities, disabled and older persons) into SGBV prevention and response mechanisms by assessing current gaps, identifying best practices, and building the staff capacity at UNHCR, implementing partners and other stakeholders, in order to increase the level of protection for these at-risk refugees.

participating-org.narrative: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
